page.title: 11WALKING
page.content: {The South Downs Way}is a Long Distance footpath which runs from Eastbourne to the Sussex_Hampshire border. It follows the scarp slope of the Downs from East to West, and walkers enjoy panoramic views of the Weald to the North and extensive vistas of Downland and Sea to the South. The traditional Downland scene of green turf, close cropped by sheep is no longer seen because the farmers do not keep sheep. The Downs are too accessible to walkers, many of whom bring dogs which worry the sheep. The area is also crossed by a number of tracks running North to South which are rights of way. Some are pre_historic , others have Roman origins. Walkers are nowadays confined to the tracks as wire fences edge all the cultivated fields.
